gurmukhi: ieh BwNq dIh kir dys rwj ]bhu kry j`ig Aru hom swj ]bhu BwNiq s√çrx kir kY su dwn ]godwn Awid ibDvq iSnwn ]15]
transliteration: Eh Bhaant Deeh Kar(i) Des Raaj|| Bahu Dare Jagg(i) Ar(u) Hom Saaj|| Bahu Bhaant Deeh Kar(i) Svaran Dar(i) Kais U Daan|| Godaan Aadh Bidhvat Shinaan||15||
translation: In this way, after conquering many kings, manu performed many hom-yajnas, he bestowed different typed of charities of gold and cows and took bath at various pilgrim-satations.15.

gurmukhi: jo huqI j`g Aru byd rIq ]so krI srb niRp lwie pRIq ]BUAdwn dwn rqnwid Awid ]idn BwNq BwNq il`ny suvwd ]16]
transliteration: Jo Houtijagg Ar(u) Bed Reet|| So Karisarab Nrip Laae Preet|| Bhooadaan Daan Ratnaadh Aadh|| Din Bhaant Bhaant Linne Suvaad||16||
translation: He performed all the Vedic traditions with devotion; he also gave various types of charities concerning lands, jewels ect.16.

gurmukhi: kir dys dys iem nIq rwj ]bhu BwNq dwn dy srb swj ]hsqwid d`q bwjwid myD ]qy BwNq BwNq ik`ny niRKyD ]17]
transliteration: Kar(i) Des Des Im Neet Raaj|| Bahu Bhaant Daan De Sarab Saaj|| Hastaadh Datt Baajaadh Medh|| Te Bhaant Bhaant Kinne Nrikhedh||17||
translation: He promulgated his policies in all the countries, and donated gifts of various type; he donated elephants ect. And performed various types of ashvamedha yajnas (horse-sacrifices). 17.

gurmukhi: bhu swj bwj id`ny idjwn ]ds cwr cwr ib`idAw sujwn ]Kt cwr SwsqR isMmiRq rtMq ]kokwid Byd bInw bjMq ]18]
transliteration: Bahu Saaj Baaj Dinne Dijaan|| Das Chaar Chaar Biddiaa Sujaan|| Khat Chaar Shaastra Siaamrit Ratant|| Kakaadh Bhed Beenaa Bajant||18||
translation: He donated many decorated horses to those Brahmins, who had the knowledge of eighteen sciences, who were the reciters of six Shastr ect. And also those who were skilful in playing various types of musical instruments.18.

gurmukhi: Gnswr Gor GsIAq gulwb ]miRg mdq fwr cUvq Srwb ]kSmIr Gws Gorq subws ]auGtq sugMD mhkMq Avws ]19]
transliteration: Ghansaar Ghor Ghaseeat Gulaab|| Mrig Madat Daar Vhoovat Sharaab|| Kashmeer Ghaas Ghorat Soubaas|| Oughtat Sougaddh Mahkant Avaas||19||
translation: At that time the Sandal and roses were rubbed and the liquor of musk was prepared; during the reign of that king, the abodes of all the people gave out the fragrance of Kashmiri grass.19.

gurmukhi: qwgVdMg qwl bwjq mucMg ]bInw subYx bMsI miRdMg ]fP qwl qurI shnwie rwg ]bwjMq jwn aupnq suhwg ]20]
transliteration: Tagaddan Taal Baajat Mouchannd|| Beenaa Soubain Bansimridan|| Daph Taal Turisahnaae Raag|| Baajant Jaan Oupnat Suhaag||20||
translation: The tunes of Iyer, drum etc. were heard; the pleasing sounds of tabors, clarions, clarionets ect. Were also heard.2o.

gurmukhi: khUM qwl qUr bInw miRdMg ]fP JwNJ Fol jl qr aupMg ]jh jh iblok qh qh subws ]au`Tq sugMD mhkMq Avws ]21]
transliteration: Kahoon Taal Toor Beenaa Mridan|| Daph Jhaanjh Dhol Jal Tar Oupan|| Jah Jah Bilok Tah Tah Soubaas|| Outthat Sougaddh Mahkant Avaas||21||
translation: Somewhere there wes tune of drum, lyer etc. and somewhere the sound of tabor, anklet, drum,musical glasses ect. Was heard; there was feeling of fragrance everywhere and with this rising odour,all the abodes seemed fragrant.21.

gurmukhi: mnu rwj krXo ]duK dys hrXo ]bhu swj s`jy ]sun dyv l`jy ]22]
transliteration: Manu Raaj Daryo|| Doukh Des Daryo|| Bahu Saaj Sajje|| Soun De Lajje||22||
translation: When manu ruled, he removed the suffering of the people and he was so good that even the gods felt shy after listening to his approbation.22.

gurmukhi: ieiq sRI bicqR nwtk mnu rwjw ko rwj smwpqm ]
transliteration: It(i) Sribachitra Naatak Manu Raajaa Ko Raaj Samaaptam||
translation: End of the description of the rule of king Manu in Bachitar Natak.

gurmukhi: AQ piRQ rwjw ko rwj kQnM ]
transliteration: Ath Prith Raajaa Ko Raaj Kathanan||
translation: Now begins the description of the rule of king Prithu.
